articles.author: NAYARA BATSCHKE, ISABEL DEBRE
articles.title: Uruguay's 2 presidential front-runners say they'll face off in a second round of voting next month - The Associated Press
articles.description: The leading contenders in Uruguay’s presidential election say voters in the small South American nation had sent the race to a run-off in November. An early count of the general elections showed Uruguay’s moderate leftist alliance leading the conservative gov…
articles.content: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay (AP) Voters in the small South American nation of Uruguay cast ballots Sunday in a presidential election in which a center-left rural mayor pulled ahead of the conservative incumb… [+5032 chars]

articles.author: Mariana Alfaro, Will Oremus
articles.title: Vance defends Trump on using U.S. military against Americans - The Washington Post
articles.description: Vice-presidential candidate JD Vance was quick to defend — and reframe — some of Donald Trump’s most controversial comments suggesting authoritarian tendencies.
articles.content:
Sen. JD Vance (R-Ohio) forcefully defended Donald Trumps vow to use the U.S. military against certain Americans, a group Trump has repeatedly labeled the enemy from within.
Across several television… [+261 chars]

articles.author: Ellen Nakashima, Josh Dawsey
articles.title: Chinese hackers said to have collected audio of American calls - The Washington Post
articles.description: The hackers, part of a group dubbed Salt Typhoon, have intercepted audio for political officials, including an unnamed Trump campaign adviser.
articles.content: Chinese state-affiliated hackershave collected audio from the phone calls of U.S. political figures, according to three people familiar with the matter. Those whose calls have been intercepted includ… [+517 chars]
